item.title: Rishi Sunak, Wife Akshata Murty Vote Against "Higher Taxes" In UK Polls
item.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak urged voters to choose the Conservative party as polling booths opened across thecountry for the general election.He shared a photo with his wife, Akshata Murty, at a polling booth.

item.title: UK Votes For A New Government, Rishi Sunak's Fate On The Line
item.description: Britons headed to the polls Thursday in a general election widely expected to emphatically return the opposition Labour party to power and end nearly a decade-and-a-half of Conservative rule.

  2. Biden Tells Allies He Knows He Has Only Days to Salvage Candidacy  The New York Times
  3. Biden Moves to Shore Up Support as Democratic Unity Cracks  The Wall Street Journal
  4. Biden faces growing political crisis over response to debate performance  The Washington Post

item.title: Video: Labour Party leader Keir Starmer casts his vote
Rapid results: UK ballot counters braced for race to declare first winner
item.description:
Boundary changes, paper thickness and ace returning officer’s transfer could have a bearing on who declares first

One of the most notable quirks of a British election begins with the sound of running shoes squeaking on a sports hall’s varnished floor.

But balls and rackets are nowhere to be seen, because the activity is a lot more niche than the usual fare. It is part of the race to be the UK’s fastest election count – where ballot boxes filled with thousands of votes are opened, counted and collated before the result is declared less than 90 minutes after the last vote was cast.

Continue reading...

item.title: New prime minister will face a range of urgent priorities from day one
item.description:
An imminent Nato summit, bursting prisons and another strike by junior doctors for starters mean whoever takes the keys to No 10 will have little to no time to celebrate

The campaign is over, but it’s only now that the really hard work begins. Every new prime minister faces a bulging in-tray of issues, decisions and potential mishaps, but this one will be arguably more laden than most.

Continue reading...

Van Jones says Democrats are discussing ‘how’ to replace Biden, ‘not whether’
As president teeters, Jill Biden faces a critical juncture
